subclassFeature.name: Bonded Eldritch Knight
entries: The Bonded Eldritch Knight combines the martial mastery common to all fighters with the careful study of magic. They use magical techniques similar to those practiced by wizards, focusing their study on two of the eight schools of magic - abjuration and evocation. Abjuration spells grant a Bonded Eldritch Knight additional protection in combat, while evocation spells damage many enemies at once, extending the fighter's reach in combat. These knights learn a comparatively small number of spells, committting them to memory rather than keeping them in a spellbook.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you augment your martial prowess with the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and {@book chapter 11|PHB|11} for the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn {@spell Booming Blade|TCE} or {@spell Green-Flame Blade|TCE}, and two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter wizard spell list|spells|class=wizard}. You learn an additional wizard cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.
For example, if you know the 1st-level spell {@spell shield} and have a 1st-level and a 2nd-level spell slot available, you can cast {@spell shield} using either slot.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-Level and Higher
entries: You know three first level spells, two of which you must choose from the {@filter evocation or abjuration|spells|level=1;2;3;4|school=a;v} school of any list. The third can be from any school of magic in the wizard spell list

The Spells Known column of the Eldritch Knight Spellcasting table shows when you learn more wizard spells of 1st level or higher. Each of these spells must be an abjuration or evocation spell of your choice, and must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 7th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st or 2nd level.
The spells you learn at 8th, 14th, and 20th level can come from any school of magic.

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the spells you know from this subclass with another spell of your choice. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots, and it must be an abjuration or evocation spell, unless you're replacing the spell you gained at 3rd, 8th, 14th, or 20th level from any school of magic.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your spells, since you learn your spells through study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a wizard spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Weapon Bond
entries: At 3rd level, you learn a ritual that creates a magical bond between you and a melee weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest. The weapon must remain within your reach throughout the ritual, at the conclusion of which you touch the weapon and forge the bond.
Once you have bonded a weapon to yourself it gains the following benefits:
You cannot be disarmed of it unless you are {@condition incapacitated}.
If they are on the same plane you can summon it to your hand as part of the attack.
It works as an arcane focus for any spell you cast that uses intelligence as a spellcasting ability.
You can have up to two bonded weapons, if you attempt to bond with a third weapon, you must break the bond with one of the other two.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Recovery
entries: When you use your {@classFeature Second Wind|Fighter||1} trait, you regain spell slots equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up), once per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: War Magic
entries: When you spend a spell slot on an abjuration spell you can make an attack with a bonded weapon.

Additionally, when you hit a creature with a bonded weapon, you can choose to give it disadvantage on its next saving throw against an evocation spell. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn, and you can affect creatures in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Indomitable Bond
entries: The bond with your weapons is strengthened and helps you resist magic. When using your {@classFeature Indomitable|Fighter||9} trait to resist a spell or magical effect, add your Intelligence modifier to the roll (minimum +1) and gain resistance to any damage that comes from that spell or effect.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Surge
entries: When you use {@classFeature Action Surge|Fighter||2} you can teleport up to 30 feet to a place you can see and cast a cantrip that requires one action as a bonus action, before or after using the aditional action.

subclassFeature.name: Improved War Magic
entries: When you spend a spell slot on an evocation spell, add your Intelligence modifier to the attack and damage rolls with your bonded weapons until the end of your next turn (minimum +1).
When you spend a spell slot on an abjuration spell, you gain advantage on your next saving throw or ability check.
